## PluginRegistry.getInputProcessor() method

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Get an input processor by ID.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getInputProcessor(id: string): ResolvedCapability<InputProcessorDefinition> | undefined;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

id


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Fully-qualified or shorthand ID


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[ResolvedCapability](./change-detector-core.resolvedcapability.md)<!-- -->&lt;[InputProcessorDefinition](./change-detector-core.inputprocessordefinition.md)<!-- -->&gt; \| undefined

The resolved capability or undefined if not found

## Remarks

Supports both fully-qualified IDs (`graphql:schema`<!-- -->) and shorthand IDs (`graphql`<!-- -->) when the plugin has only one input processor.
